etymology.description: 石(石) (shí, "stone") triplicated -> stones piled up -> sense of strength or integrity
etymology.interpretation: The character 磊(lěi, "stones piled up") uses a visual representation of three 石(石), emphasizing abundance or mass, often symbolizing strength or truth.

examples.chinese: 山脚下的石头堆积成磊(山腳下的石頭堆積成磊)。
examples.pinyin: Shān jiǎo xià de shítou duījī chéng lěi.
examples.english: The stones at the foot of the mountain piled up.

examples.chinese: 河边的石子渐渐累积(河邊的石子漸漸累積)，最终形成了磊(最終形成了磊)。
examples.pinyin: Hé biān de shízǐ jiànjiàn lěijī, zuìzhōng xíngchéng le lěi.
examples.english: The stones along the river gradually accumulated and eventually formed a pile.
